Companies.name: Apple
Companies.description: A leading technology company renowned for its innovations in consumer electronics such as the iPhone, iPad, Mac computers, and Apple Watch, as well as software like iOS and macOS.

Companies.name: Amazon
Companies.description: A global e-commerce giant that also offers cloud computing services through Amazon Web Services (AWS) and produces consumer electronics like the Kindle and Echo.

Companies.name: Alphabet
Companies.description: The parent company of Google, it dominates in online advertising, search engine technology, and also invests in ventures like self-driving cars with Waymo and health tech with Verily.

Companies.name: Home Depot
Companies.description: The largest home improvement retailer in the U.S., offering a wide range of products including tools, construction materials, and home improvement services.

Companies.name: Johnson & Johnson
Companies.description: A multinational healthcare company that produces medical devices, pharmaceuticals, and consumer health products like Band-Aid, Tylenol, and Johnson's Baby products.

Companies.name: JPMorgan Chase & Co.
Companies.description: A leading global financial services firm offering investment banking, asset management, and other financial services to individuals, corporations, and governments.

Companies.name: The Coca-Cola Company
Companies.description: A world-renowned beverage company famous for Coca-Cola, and also offers a diverse portfolio of brands including Sprite, Fanta, Minute Maid, and Dasani.

Companies.name: Meta
Companies.description: A social media and technology company formerly known as Facebook, it owns popular platforms like Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, and develops virtual reality products through Oculus.

Companies.name: Microsoft Corporation
Companies.description: A technology leader known for its software products like Windows and Office, cloud computing services via Azure, and hardware including Surface tablets and Xbox gaming consoles.

Companies.name: NVIDIA Corporation
Companies.description: Specializes in graphics processing units (GPUs) for gaming and professional markets, as well as artificial intelligence and data center technologies.

Companies.name: Novartis AG
Companies.description: A global healthcare company focusing on innovative medicines, generics, and eye care products through its divisions like Sandoz and Alcon.

Companies.name: Pfizer Inc.
Companies.description: A pharmaceutical giant known for developing widely-used medications such as Lipitor, Viagra, and the widely distributed COVID-19 vaccine, Comirnaty.

Companies.name: The Procter & Gamble Company
Companies.description: Produces a vast array of consumer goods including household names like Tide, Pampers, Gillette, and Crest across categories such as cleaning, personal health, and grooming.

Companies.name: Tesla
Companies.description: A leader in electric vehicles and clean energy, known for its electric cars like the Model S, Model 3, and energy products such as Solar Roof and Powerwall.

Companies.name: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Limited
Companies.description: The world's largest dedicated independent semiconductor foundry, manufacturing chips for various industries including consumer electronics and automotive.

Companies.name: UnitedHealth Group Incorporated
Companies.description: A diversified healthcare company offering health benefits and services through its UnitedHealthcare and Optum subsidiaries, focusing on improving health outcomes.

Companies.name: Visa Inc.
Companies.description: A global payments technology company that facilitates electronic funds transfers throughout the world, primarily through Visa-branded credit, debit, and prepaid cards.

Companies.name: Walmart Inc.
Companies.description: A multinational retail corporation that operates a chain of hypermarkets, discount department stores, and grocery stores, known for its wide variety of products at competitive prices.
